doc.previous: While within country income inequality has increased throughout the globalization period globally inequality has lessened as developing countries have experienced much more rapid growth 28 Economic inequality varies between societies historical periods economic structures or economic systems ongoing or past wars between genders and between differences in individuals abilities to create wealth 29 Among the various numerical indices for measuring economic inequality the Gini coefficient is most often cited
doc.after: Economic inequality affects equity equality of outcome and subsequent equality of opportunity Although earlier studies considered economic inequality as necessary and beneficial 31 some economists see it as an important social problem 32 Early studies suggesting that greater equality inhibits economic growth did not account for lags between inequality changes and growth changes 33 Later studies claimed that one of the most robust determinants of sustained economic growth is the level of income inequality 30
